candidates.name: Katrina Hazelhurst
candidates.why_elect: I am able to encourage debate and discussion on issues and in allowing this ensure that the widest range of community views are represented fairly in the decision making process.
candidates.why_stand: I love living in the Waitaki District but feel it cannot reach its true potential without governance that promotes transparency, accountability, ethical behaviour and inclusiveness.

candidates.name: Gary Kircher
candidates.why_elect: Knowledge of local government is critical to being an effective Mayor. Without it, time and opportunities are lost. My experience as a councillor and institutional knowledge has made me much more effective. I am very accessible, and people from all walks of life know they can contact me with issues.
candidates.why_stand: Waitaki is an amazing district, and I love playing a part in making it even better! There are so many opportunities in front of us! We are lucky to have so many passionate people who want to make Waitaki even better, and I want to help them achieve their aspirations.

candidates.name: Paul Mutch
candidates.why_elect: I have built infrastructure, marketed tourism and accommodation, and spent 25 years promoting spring festivals here and abroad. I was a farmer in the district, while also running land development projects. My broad range of leadership experience and local knowledge qualifies me highly for this position.
candidates.why_stand: I have farmed, kept bees commercially, and owned land in Waitaki for over 30 years. With considerable experience in infrastructure development, marketing, and promotion, I can see the potential of unrealised assets in the area, and I want to create a strong, proud, defined identity for Waitaki's future.
